SEARCH
Module mk.musiclibrarygui
Package mk.musiclibrarygui.models

Class SongList

java.lang.Object
mk.musiclibrarygui.models.SongList
public class SongList extends Object
The SongList class manages a collection of Song objects, providing methods to add, delete, and retrieve songs.
Version:
2.0
Author:
Michal Kaminski

    Description
    private final ArrayList<Song>
    allSongs
    A list that holds all the Song objects.

  • Method Details

    • getAllSongs

      public ArrayList<Song> getAllSongs()
      Retrieves the list of all songs.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing all the songs

    • addSong

      public void addSong(String songTitle, String authorName, String authorSurname, String songAlbum, String songRelease, String songTime) throws WrongInputException
      Adds a new song to the list after validating the input.
      Parameters:
      songTitle - The title of the song
      authorName - The composer's first name
      authorSurname - The composer's surname
      songAlbum - The album name the song belongs to
      songRelease - The release date of the song
      songTime - The duration of the song in seconds
      Throws:
      WrongInputException - if any input is invalid

    • getOneByIndex

      public Song getOneByIndex(int index) throws WrongInputException
      Retrieves a song by its index in the list.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the song to retrieve
      Returns:
      The Song object at the specified index
      Throws:
      WrongInputException - if the index is out of bounds

    • deleteOneByIndex

      public void deleteOneByIndex(int index) throws WrongInputException
      Deletes a song by its index in the list.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the song to delete
      Throws:
      WrongInputException - if the index is out of bounds

    • getSongsArraySize

      public int getSongsArraySize()
      Retrieves the number of songs in the list.
      Returns:
      The size of the songs list

    • getAllSongsObservable

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Song> getAllSongsObservable()
      Converts the list of songs to an ObservableList for use in JavaFX.
      Returns:
      An ObservableList containing all songs
